title: Complete Lightbox Example
text:
Here is a simple image with a description. This also overrides the description position and places it to the left of the image.



Beach in Chilmark

title: Complete Lightbox Example
text:
Elsewhere
The below demonstrates placing more than one image in a gallery. Note the usage of the layout-ncol which arranges the images on the page side by date. Adding the group attribute to the markdown images places the images in a gallery grouped together based upon the group name provided.





Aquinnah





Oak Bluffs







Vineyard lighthouse

title: Complete Lightbox Example
text:
With computation code chunks
Options for lightbox can be passed using chunk options.

plot(1:10, rnorm(10))




Simple demo R plot





plot(cars)




Plot about cars data




It is possible to create several plots, and group them in a lightbox gallery. Use list in YAML for options when you have several plots, on per plot.

plot(mtcars)




Caption for first plot



plot(cars)




Caption for second plot




When lightbox: auto in main YAML config, you can opt-out lightbox on a plot by setting lightbox: false

plot(mtcars)




mtcars

title: Marcelo
text:
1 + 1

[1] 2


Here I use the quarto template trestles and place the yaml label in this files yml.
Interestingly, if in the _quarto.yml nav code is like

navbar:
    left:
      - href: index.qmd
        text: Home
      - about.qmd # No href not text, directly the file name. 
      - href: Lightbox_Example.qmd
        text: Lightbox

The title will change the name of nav tab, even if in the _quarto.yml is label “About”, but only while in this page. The tab will display the title of this file’s yml, but when not in this file, the nav tab label will revert to the label from the _quarto.yml file.
I found usefull information in this pages:
- Creating your personal website using quarto
type / to add content.
once I save the content then it will appear on page.
No!, it will appear when I saved and reload page.
